sentence.Network_en: A thin, glistening thread of moisture ran along the rough concrete sill.
sentence.Network_cn: 在粗糙不平的水泥窗台上有一条细细的发光水印。

sentence.Network_en: The Royal Airforce sill remained dangerously short of bombers.
sentence.Network_cn: 英国皇家空军仍未脱离极为缺乏轰炸机的危境.

sentence.Network_en: The blind was drawn, but I found a rift at the sill.
sentence.Network_cn: 遮帘拉了下来, 但我在窗台上找到了一个缝隙.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English syll, sylle 'horizontal beam forming a foundation', of Germanic origin; related to German Schwelle 'threshold'

entry.def: A sill is a shelf along the bottom edge of a window, either inside or outside a building.

example.ex: Whitlock was perched on the sill of the room's only window.
example.tran: 惠特洛克坐在房间里仅有的那扇窗户的边沿上。

means.word_mean: 1. structural member consisting of a continuous horizontal timber forming the lowest member of a framework or supporting structure
2. (geology) a flat (usually horizontal) mass of igneous rock between two layers of older sedimentary rock

auth_sentence.content: The blind-cord drawls across the window sill.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The blind-cord drawls across the window sill.

auth_sentence.content: From the sill, a naked man dangled by his fingertips.

sentences.en: Thirty-one cakes, dampened with whiskey, bask on window sills and shelves.
sentences.cn: 三十一个浸润着威士忌的潮湿蛋糕，正在窗台和架子上晾晒着。
